intro: Echites guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is not commonly cultivated but is of interest in botanical studies.
